meanings.definition: To stop or interrupt the progress or course of something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher quickly intercepts the student before he leaves the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The security guard intercepts any unauthorized individuals trying to enter the building.
meanings.sent3: The playful dog intercepts the ball mid-air, eager to continue the game.
meanings.sent4: The superhero intercepts the villain's evil plan, saving the city from disaster.
meanings.sent5: The goalie intercepts the soccer ball, preventing a goal from being scored.

meanings.definition: To catch or seize something before it reaches its intended destination.
meanings.sent1: The postal worker intercepts the package before it is delivered to the wrong address.
meanings.sent2: The spy intercepts the secret message before it falls into the wrong hands.
meanings.sent3: The clever cat intercepts the mouse just as it tries to escape.
meanings.sent4: The detective intercepts the criminal at the airport, foiling his escape plan.
meanings.sent5: The goalkeeper intercepts the opponent's pass, preventing a scoring opportunity.

meanings.definition: A point at which a line, curve, or surface intersects or crosses another.
meanings.sent1: The two roads meet at the intercepts, creating a busy intersection.
meanings.sent2: The graph shows the intercepts where the line crosses the x and y axes.
meanings.sent3: The treasure map marks the intercepts where the paths of the pirates converge.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting captures the beauty of the intercepts of light and shadow.
meanings.sent5: The architect carefully plans the building's design to highlight the intercepts of different materials.
